title.narrative: Advancing Children with Disabilities Rights in EAP

description.narrative: Children with disabilities remain one of the most marginalized and excluded groups, experiencing widespread violations of their rights. Children with disabilities are not a homogenous group. Issues of discrimination, exclusion, and child development vary greatly depending upon the type of disability, the environment, culture, traditions, and socioeconomic status of the child and their families. This Australian aid program recognises the importance of education as a pathway out of poverty, and has child protection as a fundamental requirement for all aid and development programs. Funding under this investments provides support through the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) for REAP 2 DFAT_UNICEF partnership to accelerate responses to the rights of children with disabilities (with a focus on the East Asia and the Pacific region (EAP). The total value of this investment is $4.5 million over 4 years, starting 2014-15.
